# makeFunction(name:)

**Instance Method**

Creates an instance that represents a shader function in the library.

## Declaration

```swift
func makeFunction(name functionName: String) -> (any MTLFunction)?
```

## Parameters

- **functionName**: The name of the function.

## Return Value

An [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunction], or `nil` if the named function isn’t found in the library.

## Discussion

If you call this method to retrieve a function that doesn’t use function constants, it returns an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunction] instance that you can use to build a render or compute pipeline.

If you call this method to retrieve a function that uses function constants to specialize its behavior, you can only use the returned instance to query the `functionConstants` property for the list of function constants. You can’t use to create a render or compute pipeline. To get a specialized instance that you can use to create a pipeline instance, call the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLibrary/makeFunction(name:constantValues:completionHandler:)] method or [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLibrary/makeFunction(name:constantValues:)] to generate a specialized function.

## Related Documentation

- **Metal Shading Language Guide**
- **Metal Programming Guide**

## Creating shader function instances

- **makeFunction(name:constantValues:completionHandler:)**: Asynchronously creates a specialized shader function.
- **makeFunction(name:constantValues:)**: Synchronously creates a specialized shader function.
- **makeFunction(descriptor:completionHandler:)**: Asynchronously creates an object representing a shader function, using the specified descriptor.
- **makeFunction(descriptor:)**: Synchronously creates an object representing a shader function, using the specified descriptor.
